description: From Middle English payle (“bucket, pail, milking pail”).

entries.meaning: A vessel of wood, tin, plastic, etc., usually cylindrical and having a handle -- used especially for carrying liquids, for example water or milk; a bucket (sometimes with a cover).
examples: The milkmaid carried a pail of milk in each hand.

entries.meaning: (In technical use) A closed (covered) cylindrical shipping container.
